reviewText: Before The Girls Next Door: Season One there was this. 90 min, about Hef's life and living quarters. Famous people include Pam Anderson, Drew Carey, Bill Maher, Hef's doctor, Barbi Benton, Shannon Tweed, Tony Curtis, Bill Cosby, Don Adams, Robert Culp, Dick Van Patton and Arnold. He got divorced in 1959, he has a huge scrap book collection of his life. He was in the Army. Black and white footage of the first mansion in Chicago and parties, he talks about the Play Boy philosophy which is "Do what you want as long as you don't hurt others. "He has a regular 'Movie Night' that he invites friends to attend. At one point he had a plane called 'The Bunny' He has a massive movie collection. He moves to the California mansion in 1971, Barbie Benton helps. It is on the grounds of UCLA. There is a zoo there He married Kim Conrad in 1991 and had two sons, the parties stopped. She dumps him so he gets back to parties. Interesting and informative.
I like this Video of the Playboy Mansion and talks about Hef's History right up to his "Beautiful Roommates". Great Buy!
Not Porn but has some photos from Playboy. Useful as a history piece or anyone visiting the playboy mansion in LA

This film about Hugh Hefner's Playboy Mansion is great fun, especially if you fantasize about being the ruler of that famous home. This is actually quite a sedate, documentary-type look at the overall life at the mansion, showing not only scenes of the ladies and fun parties there, but also an extensive amount about the various parts of the home, the business activities of the company, the history of Playboy, many comments from relevant people, and the like. While the focus here is not on getting to see the sexy ladies in the buff, there is a lot more of that on this film than on A & E's edited broadcast. Also, if you wonder why there are two different covers sold for this DVD, one of Hef with some of the ladies, and another showing the mansion, I've seen the DVDs from both, and as far as I have noticed they are identical. For more on the ladies at the mansion, you might try the videos Playboy - Mansion Parties Totally Uncensored and Playboy - Mansion Parties, Hottest Moments & Body Painting I like seeing "Inside the Playboy Mansion," then one of the two I just mentioned for a "behind the scenes" look. I've enjoyed watching "Inside the Playboy Mansion" many times, so to me this is well worth buying if you're interested in Hef and his home.

I think that this movie and the other one just like it ("Playboy 2000 - The Party Continues") are supposed to be additions and updates to the old documentary about Hugh Hefner ("Hugh Hefner: Once Upon a Time").  All of the movies talk about the history of Hefner and Playboy.  The "Once Upon a Time" movie concluded with Hefner married, the other movie, "2000 -The Party Continues", goes over more of the History of Playboy plus how Hefner started the parties back up after he seperated from his wife.  This movie is the most up to date.  It talks about what Hef does in the Mansion (wwith his multiple girlfriends) recently.
This movie is pretty interesting, it gives you a nice glimpse into the mansion and into what Hef does these days, but I did have a couple of complaints. The main thing that I didn't like is that the original "Once Upon a Time" movie talked about the good times and the bad times. This movie just talks about the good times. The other thing is that a good part of this movie just goes over what the other two movies covered before.  This movie is about 90 minutes, but it probably only has about 30 minutes of content not seen in the other two movies.
If you're interested in the history of Hef and Playboy, this movie is a good rental. It's only worth watching once though, I wouldn't say it's worth buying. (Actually, you might be able to catch it on the "A & E" cable channel.  I first saw it shown on that channel).  Then watch the other two movies as well (especially "Hugh Hefner: Once Upon a Time"). If you're looking for a Playboy movie with Playmates dancing around naked, there's very little of that in this movie. Look elsewhere.
